item.title: Bangladesh awaits verdict on Chankharpul murders during July Uprising
item.description: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) is set to deliver the verdict in the case filed over the six murders in Dhaka’s Chankharpul during the July Uprising. Tuesday’s verdict will decide the fate of eight suspects, including former Dhaka Metropolitan Police commissioner Habibur Rahm

item.title: Higher NPLs a key concern: ICCB
item.description: The International Chamber of Commerce-Bangladesh (ICCB) has pinpointed persistently high level of non-performing loans (NPLs) as one of the 'most serious structural concerns' in the financial sector of Bangladesh. The chamber in its editorial published in the October-December 2025 Quarterly News B

item.title: Karachi mall fire death toll rises to 23 as rescuers search for dozens missing
item.description: The death toll from a massive fire at a shopping plaza in Karachi rose to 23 on Monday as rescuers recovered more bodies from the badly damaged building, police said. Dozens remain missing. Firefighters extinguished the blaze at the multistory plaza late Sunday, nearly 24 hours after it erupted, a

item.title: Jhenaidah reels from 301 suicides in one year
item.description: Jhenaidah has been rocked by a disturbing surge in suicides, with 301 people taking their own lives in 2025, laying bare deep-rooted mental health challenges, intense social pressures and gaps in public safety. Women account for a disproportionate share of the deaths, heightening concerns over the

item.title: China's wedding dress sellers pin hopes on rise in marriages
item.description: Wedding vendors at Huqiu Bridal City in Suzhou, one of China's largest wedding dress markets, are hopeful the country's positive marriage trends will continue this year. The rise in marriages in the first nine months of 2025 is a bright spot in China's otherwise grim population landscape. Official

item.title: Motorcyclist dies in Bogura road accident
item.description: A motorcyclist was killed in a road accident in the Shajbari area of Bogura district on Monday evening. The deceased was identified as Fanos Mia, 55, son of Anwar Hossain Montu of Dhakandia Pukurpara village under Shajahanpur upazila. The accident occurred in front of Fatema Filling Station on th

item.title: UK mulls Australia-style ban on social media for children
item.description: Britain is considering a range of measures to better protect children online, including an Australian-style ban on social media for those below a certain age and tougher guidance for use of mobile phones in schools, it said on Monday. The government said it would examine evidence from around the w

item.title: Trump says Denmark cannot protect Greenland
item.description: US President Donald Trump on Monday said the United States would talk about acquiring Greenland at this week's Davos World Economic Forum because Denmark cannot protect the country. "We have to have it. They have to have this done. They can't protect it, Denmark, they're wonderful people," Trump t

item.title: Tribunal defers verdict in Chankharpul crimes against humanity case to Jan 26
item.description: The International Crimes Tribunal has deferred the verdict in a crimes against humanity case filed over the six murders in Dhaka’s Chankharpul during the July Uprising to Jan 26. The fate of eight suspects, including former Dhaka Metropolitan Police commissioner Habibur Rahman, will now rema

item.title: Canada could send small contingent of troops to Greenland
item.description: Canada is considering whether to send a small contingent of troops to Greenland to take part in NATO military exercises, a source directly familiar with the matter said on Monday. The news was first reported by the CBC News and the Globe and Mail newspaper. Military officials have presented plans

item.title: Trump ties his stance on Greenland to not getting Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: US President Donald Trump linked his aggressive stance on Greenland to last year’s decision not to award him the Nobel Peace Prize, telling Norway’s prime minister that he no longer felt “an obligation to think purely of Peace,” in a text message released Monday. Trump's me

item.title: Chile wildfires kill 19 amid extreme heat; scores evacuated
item.description: Wildfires in Chile have killed at least 19 people, authorities said on Monday, as the government carried out mass evacuations and fought over 30 blazes exacerbated by intense heat and high winds.
